intro: Gynochthodes parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved gynochthodes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with four petals and a prominent corolla. Gynochthodes parvifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
